facts.seriesTitle: Population below international poverty line (percent)
facts.fact_text: The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line declined from 9.9 % in 1990 to 1.3% in 2016.

facts.seriesTitle: Employed population below international poverty line (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2016, 0.3 % of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of population living below the national poverty line (percent)
facts.fact_text: The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was approximately20 % in 2017.

facts.seriesTitle: Existence of legislative and/or regulatory provisions for managing disaster risk
facts.fact_text: As of 2013, Costa Rica has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

facts.seriesTitle: Prevalence of undernourishment (percent)
facts.fact_text: The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 4.4 % in 2016 .

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of children under 5 years of age who are moderately or severely overweight
facts.fact_text: The share of overweight children under 5 years of age was approximately8.1 % in 2008.

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of children under 5 years of age who are moderately or severely overweight
facts.fact_text: The share of overweight children under 5 years of age was approximately8.1 % in 2008.

facts.seriesTitle: Maternal mortality ratio
facts.fact_text: The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 43 per 100,000 live births in 1990 to 25 per 100,000 live births in 2015.

facts.seriesTitle: Under-five mortality rate
facts.fact_text: The mortality rate of children under 5 years of age fell from 12.9 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 9 per 1,000 live births in 2017.

facts.seriesTitle: Number of new HIV infections per 1,000 uninfected population
facts.fact_text: In 2017, there were about 0.22 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.

facts.seriesTitle: Participation rate in organized learning (one year before the official primary entry age)
facts.fact_text: In 2016, 89.21 % of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school

facts.seriesTitle: Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics by the end of primary education
facts.fact_text: The gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1.01 in 2013 , meaning 101.0 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.

facts.seriesTitle: Gender parity index for achievement in reading by the end of primary education
facts.fact_text: The gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.02 in 2013 , meaning 102.0 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of women aged 20-24 years who were married or in a union before age 18 (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2011, 21.2 % of women between 20 to 24 years of age reported having been married before their eighteenth birthday

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (percent)
facts.fact_text: The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 19.3 % in 2000 to 35.09% in 2018.

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of population using safely managed drinking water services (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2015, 89.8 % of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water serviceâ€“an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of population with primary reliance on clean fuels and technology (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2017, more than 95 % of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of population with primary reliance on clean fuels and technology (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2017, more than 95 % of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.

facts.seriesTitle: Annual growth rate of real GDP per capita (percent)
facts.fact_text: The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita increased from 1.8 % in 2000 to 2.17% in 2017.

facts.seriesTitle: Domestic material consumption per capita (tonnes)
facts.fact_text: Domestic material consumption increased from 7.01 metric tons per capita in 2000 to 7.51 metric tons per capita in 2017.

facts.seriesTitle: Unemployment rate of population 15 years of age and older
facts.fact_text: The total unemployment rate increased from 5.1 % in 2000 to 8.1% in 2017.

facts.seriesTitle: Carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP (kg per constant 2010 US dollars)
facts.fact_text: The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.12 kg in 2000 to 0.1 kg in 2016.

facts.seriesTitle: Research and development expenditure as a proportion of GDP (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2016, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.46 % of GDP, up from 0.41 % in 2000

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of population covered by at least a 2G mobile network (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2017, 97.3 % of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal

facts.seriesTitle: Labour share of GDP, comprising wages and social protection transfers (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2015, 31.9 % of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers

facts.seriesTitle: Proportion of urban population living in slums (percent)
facts.fact_text: The proportion of the urban population living in slums declined from 10.9 % in 2005 to 5.5% in 2014.

facts.seriesTitle: Annual mean levels of fine particulate matter in cities (micrograms per cubic meter)
facts.fact_text: In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameter (PM2.5) was about 15.85 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

facts.seriesTitle: Existence of legislative and/or regulatory provisions for managing disaster risk
facts.fact_text: As of 2013, Costa Rica has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

facts.seriesTitle: Domestic material consumption per capita (tonnes)
facts.fact_text: Domestic material consumption increased from 7.01 metric tons per capita in 2000 to 7.51 metric tons per capita in 2017.

facts.seriesTitle: Existence of legislative and/or regulatory provisions for managing disaster risk
facts.fact_text: As of 2013, Costa Rica has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

facts.seriesTitle: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas (Exclusive Economic Zones) (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2018, 0.83 % of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.

facts.seriesTitle: Average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas (percent)
facts.fact_text: The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 0 % in 2018 .

facts.seriesTitle: Average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas (percent)
facts.fact_text: The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 41.72 % in 2018 .

facts.seriesTitle: Average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas (percent)
facts.fact_text: The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 0 % in 2018 .

facts.seriesTitle: Average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas (percent)
facts.fact_text: The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 41.72 % in 2018 .

facts.seriesTitle: Number of victims of intentional homicide per 100,000 population
facts.fact_text: In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 11.77 per 100,000 population.

facts.seriesTitle: Volume of remittances as a proportion of total GCP (percent)
facts.fact_text: In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 0.95 % of GDP, up from 0.16 % in 1990

facts.seriesTitle: Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services (percent)
facts.fact_text: Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services declined from 22.62 % in 1990 to 5.46% in 2016.

facts.seriesTitle: Fixed internet broadband subscriptions per 100 inhabitants
facts.fact_text: In 2017 , fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 15.17 % of the population, up from 0.22% of the population in 2002.

facts.seriesTitle: Existence of national statistical plans that are fully funded
facts.fact_text: As of 2018, Costa Rica.
